column5: Pete, I needed things from a hardware store that I could not get in Vermilion Bay so it was closer to go to Ear Falls [35 miles] than to Dryden [60 miles]. With our truck it costs $40.00 dollars round trip to go Dryden, ouch. Also, the BP variety store is also our Post Office and it's 10 miles north so I could kill 2 birds with one stone.
A $100.00 American bill equals $92.00 Canadian today in the beer store in Red Lake.

Will I be better off exchanging American money for Canadian funds or just use American when purchasing items in Ear Falls?? Will most places in Ear Falls take American money? I will be with a large group so not using credit card. Any good place to exchange money before I get to Ear Falls? Thanks in advance for any help.

There is a bank in Ear Falls, I just passed it 2 days ago when I went to the hardware store. It's just off of 105 kind of behind the IGA grocery store. It's in a strip mall with Home Hardware, Liquor Store, Wilson's grocery and then the bank. All the places I have been to during the last 3 weeks do take U.S. funds so you don't have to worry. Good luck fishing!

If you have the time exchange your American money for Canadian funds at a bank to get the best possible rate. The beer stores will be charging a pretty price if you pay in American money. And that's just one of the places you'll be visiting.
Is it worth the trouble? From what I've seen, exchange rate is about even.

In the past years I have been just using my credit card for everything. I get the daily exchange rate and no one has ever complained about it. Also save me from having to exchange money. Works at the liquor store...

our group of four has always used one credit card for all gas purchases. we've been doing this for the past 5 or 6 years and it has worked well so far. when the card holder gets the bill we divide it by four. we still do get about $100 changed at the border for food on the way up and for licenses.
Rose, What were you doing that far north? Pete

>If you have the time exchange your American money for >Canadian funds at a bank to get the best possible rate. The >beer stores will be charging a pretty price if you pay in >American money. And that's just one of the places you'll be >visiting. Actually the beer store exchange rate is re-set daily and is within .01 of bank rate. Yesterday the rate was 92%.

I use my Visa card for everything I can. Let Visa take care of the exchange. I also stop at a bank right when we enter Ontario and take out cash from the ATM. I get charged with a $2 fee but it's quick and easy.
Not worth the hassle. As of yesterday, one US dollar is .98873 Canadian dollar.
